perturbation.original_text: In consideration of the payments, through the issuance of securities to AJR as provided for in Section 3 hereof, AJR agrees to designate XC as an associate sponsor and the "exclusive technology sponsor" for wearable computer technology" of the Team for the Season and grants to XC the rights and benefits of such sponsorship as more fully set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration of the payments, through the issuance of securities to AJR as provided for in Section 3 hereof, AJR agrees to designate XC as an associate underwriter and the "exclusive technology provider" for wearable computer technology" of the Team for the Season and grants to XC the rights and benefits of such sponsorship as more fully set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'sponsor' to 'underwriter' and 'technology sponsor' to 'technology provider' creates ambiguity about XC's role. Is XC a financial backer, a technology supplier, or both? This introduces uncertainty in enforcement because the specific obligations associated with each role are different.

perturbation.original_text: AJR shall use its best efforts to promote the name, image, brand and reputation of XC and the products and services of XC. In addition, AJR shall assist XC in evaluating various applications of wearable and wireless devices to automobile racing including
perturbation.changed_text: AJR shall use reasonable efforts to promote the name, image, brand and reputation of XC and the deliverables and activities of XC. In addition, AJR may assist XC in evaluating various applications of wearable and wireless devices to automobile racing including
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'best efforts' with 'reasonable efforts' lowers the required standard of performance and replacing 'products and services' with 'deliverables and activities' creates uncertainty about what AJR is obligated to promote. Changing 'shall assist' to 'may assist' makes it optional, causing a contradiction in AJR's obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to earlier termination as provided for herein, the term of this Agreement shall commence as of the date hereof and shall terminate at the end of the Season which is scheduled to end on October 12, 2002 (the "Term").
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to earlier termination as provided for herein, the duration of this Agreement shall commence as of the date hereof and shall terminate at the end of the Season which is scheduled to end on November 12, 2002 (the "Term").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'term' to 'duration' isn't problematic by itself, but changing the scheduled end date of the season from 'October 12, 2002' to 'November 12, 2002' causes a contradiction about when the agreement actually ends. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement because the time-dependent clauses will be unclear.
